pageContext.claim: “It's been such a terrible one-way street with China having -- with a deficit of at a minimum $375 billion a year, and it's for a long time.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump generally inflates this figure to $500 billion. But there is no "minimum." The goods deficit in 2017 was $375 billion, the number that Trump is citing here, but $335 billion when the trade in services figure is calculated. In 2018, despite Trump's efforts, the trade deficit had gone up.
